snippet: State regulators approved a plan by Blue Cross of California to spin off most of its parts into a for-profit subsidiary.   The California Department of Corporations said Friday that it had issued a license to Blue Cross that would allow the nonpro...
lead_paragraph: State regulators approved a plan by Blue Cross of California to spin off most of its parts into a for-profit subsidiary. The California Department of Corporations said Friday that it had issued a license to Blue Cross that would allow the nonprofit company to create a for-profit unit. The new company, expected to be formed this year, would include Blue Cross's 423,000-member health maintenance organization, its 1.5 million-member preferred provider network and the company's pharmacy, dental, mental health, senior and workers' compensation programs.
